means: （使）窘迫，（使）局促不安( embarrass的过去式和过去分词)

sentence.Network_en: They wolf-whistled at me, and I was so embarrassed I tripped up.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们吹口哨挑逗我，我窘迫之下绊了一跤。

sentence.Network_en: This practice embarrassed Luther, but he let it pass without comment.
sentence.Network_cn: 这种做法让卢瑟难堪，但是他未置一词。

sentence.Network_en: Polly, bewildered and embarrassed, dropped her head and scuffed her feet.
sentence.Network_cn: 波莉既困惑又尴尬，低下头拖着脚走开了。

PerfectNetExp.abs: 难字的解释---在线新华字典 ... 难为〖 embarrass〗 难为情〖 ashamed;embarrassed〗 难为听〖 beunpleasanttohear〗.

九年级英语单词表 ... costume 成套服装；戏装 embarrassed 尴尬的；为难的 empty 空的；排空.
《新概念英语》第一册词汇表 - 豆丁网 ... electric 带电的， 可通电的 embarrassed 尴尬的， 窘迫的 employee 雇员.

list.abs: ...respiratory distress syndrome （RDS）呼吸窘迫综合症respiratory embarrassment 呼吸窘迫respiratory failure 呼吸衰竭
列举些类似My Goodness!... ... 113 How dreadful！ 真可怕！ 114 How embarrassing！ 好糗啊！ 115 How exciting！ 多刺激呀！.
作_互动百科 ... 【feel embarrassed;feel awkward】 为难;受窘 【make things difficult for sb.】 阻挠;刁难.
不好意思的英语是什么？ - 已解决 -... ... Embarrassed Interview 喜来登面试 be embarrassed 受窘 feel embarrassed 感觉尴尬.

entry.def: A person who is embarrassed feels shy, ashamed, or guilty about something.

means.word_mean: 1. feeling or caused to feel uneasy and self-conscious;

sentences.sentence: "chagrined at the poor sales of his book"

means.word_mean: 2. caused to feel self-conscious and uncomfortable;

sentences.sentence: "the child felt embarrassed by the attention of the adults"

means.word_mean: 3. made to feel uncomfortable because of shame or wounded pride;

sentences.sentence: "too embarrassed to say hello to his drunken father on the street"
"humiliated that his wife had to go out to work"
"felt mortified by the comparison with her sister"

auth_sentence.content: We're almost embarrassed to have to do this.
auth_sentence.res_content: We're almost embarrassed to have to do this.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: We're almost embarrassed to have to do this.

auth_sentence.content: It has actually embarrassed and shamed us a lot.
auth_sentence.res_content: It has actually embarrassed and shamed us a lot.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: It has actually embarrassed and shamed us a lot.

auth_sentence.content: The soldiers are a bit embarrassed by their performance.
auth_sentence.res_content: The soldiers are a bit embarrassed by their performance.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The soldiers are a bit embarrassed by their performance.

Sentence.sentence: It's no longer the case that the common man in England is embarrassed to show he knows about food," Tomes says.
Black students feel somewhat embarrassed among white peers during the freshman year
The owner was too embarrassed to talk to his employees.
Oh, I think that's because we're embarrassed.

means.word_mean: 局促不安的；为难的；窘迫的，尴尬的，害羞的

sentences.en: A parrot can sometimes make you embarrassed.
sentences.cn: 鹦鹉有时候会让人很尴尬。

sentences.en: He always mumbles when he’s embarrassed.
sentences.cn: 他感到难为情时说话就含糊不清了。

sentences.en: He felt acutely embarrassed at being the centre of attention.
sentences.cn: 成为大家注意的焦点使他感到非常不自然。

sentences.en: He became embarrassed when a journalist asked him pointed questions about his finances.
sentences.cn: 一名记者对他的经济情况接连提出尖锐的问题，他很是尴尬。

means.word_mean: 窘迫的；陷入困境的；拮据的；经济困难的
